title: Problems with Thunderbird Calendar "blanking" on me.
content:
I am a long-time user of Thunderbird and have relied on the calendar application extensively. I recently had to purchase a new computer and had to install updated software for everything including Thunderbird. The calendar is giving me fits... When the computer is turned off, I lose all records of previous meetings as well as all scheduled meetings in the future (as well as any scheduled recurring meetings) along with the links to the online meetings. I assume that I have a problem in my settings but I don't know where to begin... I have looked for other similar problems on line and most seem to be associated with sync-ing with other calendar applications - but I don' use other calendar applications and don't sync with any other applications.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
creator: dmt.equip2010

title: Unable to set up two accounts from same email server on Windows 11.
content: On Windows 11 when I try to set up two accounts for two separate users on the same email server I get an error. When I do the same on Windows 10, it works as expected. Both Windows have the exact same versions of Thunderbird. Why should this be? Can I do something to get it to work? I will provide any additional information requested to get at this.

title: Gmail: on opening TB, most pre-existing subfolders are missing/downloaded anew and all are displayed open, uncollapsed
content:
Sort of continuing from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1423702

Now trying 139.0.2 on a old laptop the subfolders are not mixed in the root anymore, but when opening TB, the subfolders are only partially listed. The listing changes every time.

TB then creates/downloads the missing ones/the subfolder structure but then leaves them all displayed as open/uncollapsed, which is a massive folder tree to navigate down. Takes ages and is a total pita.

We could even live with being able to collapse all the folders in one action, but there is no command for that.

I read elsewhere it may be a problem with OAuth so changed to app password, no difference.

Maybe it's the very large quantity of subfolders...

I note that the profile folder is the same size when TB is opened or closed....indicates that TB has the folders downloaded but needs to sync to display them?? No idea really.

But, we've been avoiding updating for a year and a half, need a solution or another client.

Thanks for any help.
creator: torvista

title: Having difficulties to set and get connected to an email account
content:
Hi every one, hope someone can help me.

I have a special mail account: contact@c-serp.fr

The incoming server is managed by my Synology NAS server (MailPlus server), the identifiers are Incoming server : - protocol: imap - hostname: c-serp.fr - Port: 993 - Connection security: SSL - authentication method: normal password - username: contact@c-serp.fr - Pwd: -------------------

Outgoing server : - protocol: smtp - host name: smtp-relay.brevo.com - Port: 587 - Connection security: STARTSSL - authentication method: normal password - username: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX@smtp-brevo.com - Pwd: --------------------

All these settings work perfectly on outlook 2021. But on Thunderbird, nothing works.

Why is this? Any suggestions are welcome

Ucan.

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)I have an email account

title: I am continuing to have issues with having to repeatedly enter my email password to download new messages and now it will not download any messages at all
content:
For a couple of months now I have not been able to keep the email client logged into my email account. Every so often I have needed to re-enter my email password in download my emails. However, this does not happen with my email on my Apple iphone, it functions normally. Last year, I added a laptop email using Thunderbird and it also is now having this issue starting about the same time as my desktop. I did not have any issues with my email until several weeks ago and it happens on both computers. I asked here what to check, and followed the instructions given here, still no change. In fact, on my desktop, it no longer will download any emails, no matter how many times I enter my password.

I use the desktop for my regular email use, with the laptop used for when I travel. The iPhone is mostly as notification of emails so I can answer on my desktop.

Let me repeat, everything has worked well and without issues until a few weeks ago. I made no changes in my settings prior to that, no changes to my internet provider, no other changes than normal software updates to Thunderbird.

Thank you for your past guidance and for future help.
creator: kw31836

title: TROUBLE LOADING NEW EMAIL ACCOUNTS
content:
After loading the new update for TB on laptop, it successfully uploaded one of my 6 email accounts, my primary one protouch@comcast.net, and it works fine, can send and receive emails no problem. BUT when I went to load my other comcast.net accounts I keep getting an error message from the server. Have tried over and over and don't know what to do. But the email accounts (all of them) load and work well on the BLUEMAIL account on my phone and also on my laptop, but TB doesn't. Any ideas? HERE'S THE MESSAGE I KEEP GETTING - and I've checked all the settings and they are correct, plus I've tried it with VPN ON and OFF, same results. Bill

Unable to connect

An error occurred during a connection to localhost. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.


P.S. One more problem - when TB loaded it did not bring over my address book, but I do have a complete address book on my bluemail account. Anyone know how to download my BM addresses and load them into my TB book? Thanks

title: Can't connect Xfinity e-mail account to Thunderbird
content: I installed Thunderbird (T-bird), and on the "Set Up Your Existing Email Address" tab, I entered my Xfinity e-mail address/password and clicked on "Continue". T-Bird is able to find the proper configuration in the Mozilla ISP database. I clicked the IMAP radio button and then "Done". That opens a popup window with the heading "Enter credentials for <my-email-address> on imap.comcast.net, but the window never prompts for anything (a prompt for my Xfinity password is what I expected). Instead I just get a message headlined "Unable to connect", with the subtitle "The connection was refused when attempting to contact localhost". This is followed by three suggestions for why that might be the case. I verified that: 1. The Xfinity site is NOT "temporarily unavailable" - I can log into Xfinity directly and see my messages. 2. My computer's network connection is operational since I can load any website at will. 3. I do have Windows firewall enabled, and I suspect that is root of the problem. How can I permit T-Bird to access the web??? Thanks.
creator: ajit011
